title: Pensioner faces 350 lashes
text: 09:25 nw28840 said: When I lived out there 1999-2000, the first thing I received was ' an expats guide to survival in Saudi' , it contained complete works on how to make wine beer and stronger drinks, my personal favourite was the homemade Baileys ??.But to take it out of the compound and have it in your car....that's plain stupid and him having lived there for 25 years, he must have known the risks involved.I went to a few illegal bars when out in Saudi and also met guys who were selling the 'real stuff' , could get a bottle of Johnnie Walker back then for +- $100. Wasn't for me , would rather spend my evenings over in Bahrain and enjoy a proper beer. Yep. I knew someone whose cat knocked a bottle of Bacardi(? I think) over and smashed it. The way they told it they were wringing the cat out well before thinking about taking it to the vet.As above, most people just brewed and consumed on the compound. Telegraph site won't let me read the article but I guess the guy is a bit unlucky and you don't hear of many Saudis getting caught with alcohol.
